text: parfait is a fine way to start the day
but it's even better when it's in
popsicle form ice-cold from the freezer
you start with a cup of Greek yogurt and
mixed berries so blueberries raspberries
and strawberries these are very easy to
haul with a paring knife just go right
in and twist and out pops the stem and
then you just want to cut this into
small enough pieces to fit easily into
your mold and it does need a little bit
of sweetness the yogurt is plain and
unsweetened so three tablespoons of
honey does a nice job and give that a
good mix around just to blend everything
and then it goes right into the mold
this will make about five or six
popsicles it depends on the size of the
mold you're using you could mash the
berries a little bit if you want to get
that berry flavor all through that
yogurt and give it a little bit of a hue
and then you can just spoon it right
into your mold this is one of those
situations where you just really have to
get in there with your fingers to help
guide the yogurt and fruit into the mold
for the next one tropical fruits my
favorite I have a banana a kiwi and some
pineapple again you'll want a cup of
fruit and a cup of yogurt and I'll just
give us a quick slice you could also use
mango with the tropical fruits or a
papaya the Kiwi is pretty it adds a
little burst of color and texture from
those black seeds and I think we
probably only need half of a banana here
I love anything like this that feels
like a treat like a dessert but actually
it's very healthy packed with protein
and calcium from the yogurt and natural
sugars which are good for you from the
fruit and then the pineapple for
sweetness again about three tablespoons
that a good stir and again just fill
your molds with the mixture this third
variation is a little different it's
quite simply yogurt and jam I like
apricot so that's what I'm using but
whatever your favorite is works and
you'll want a cup and a half of yogurt
to get the same yield of popsicles since
you're only using half a cup of the jam
to replace an entire cup of fresh fruit
the jam is quite sweet
so you don't need the honey here into
the bowl it goes
and stir it about I kind of like to have
its world throughout so I don't mix it
completely that already looks good and
again right into the mold and a quick
wipe of the top make sure it's all clean
you can also give it a little bit of a
tap on the counter to make sure there
aren't any air pockets in there and then
of course has to be on a popsicle stick
so get those in and these need to go
into the freezer for at least eight
hours and up to a month we're only one
step away from popsicle paradise and
that's the coating on the outside of
each one so first the mixed berries
drizzle one side with honey sort of the
long narrow side and drizzle it around
and then this one is going to get
granola for crunch and a little more
nourishment tropical fruits I like to do
toasted coconut and for the jam well I
love apricot and pistachio together and
there you have it simple and
irresistible three ways of putting
parfait into popsicle form it's the
perfect breakfast on the go
